SEARCH
Package gridgames

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
gridgames.GameController
public final class GameController extends Object
Class which handles modifications of a Game instance.

It acts as a bridge between the user and the classes that need the user to do something before they continue executing, or simply need the user to interact with them through elements like buttons.

The GameController methods execute public methods of a Game instance depending on user's choices, to consistently modify the state of the game. They all rely on an instance of GameInput to get user's inputs as well as custom messages to send through the game notification system.

NOTE: The GameController instance is th "Controller" of the Model-View-Controller pattern used to design this project.

See Also:
  • GameInput

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(Game game)
      Constructs a newly allocated GameController object by giving a Game instance to interact with. This GameController uses a CLI as default GameInput instance, to get user's inputs and associated messages.
      Parameters:
      game - The Game instance to interact with.
      See Also:
      • GameInput
      • CLI

  • Method Details

    • setGame

      public void setGame(Game game)
      Sets the instance of Game this GameController can interact with.
      Parameters:
      game - The instance of Game to set this GameController with.

    • setInput

      public void setInput(GameInput input)
      Sets the instance of GameInput this GameController can use to get user's inputs and information messages.
      Parameters:
      input - The instance of GameInput to set this GameController with.

    • mouseClicked

      public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent e, int normalizer)
      Calls Game.validateSelection() when the user clicks with a mouse on a Swing graphical user interface component.

      Relies on the GameInput.getMouseCoordinates(MouseEvent) implementation of the GameInput instance of this GameController.

      The mouse coordinates need to be normalized to be interpreted as row and column coordinates. This can be achieved using the int normalizer parameter, which does the following: 

       int col = x / normalizer;
 int row = y / normalizer;
      Where x and y are the mouse coordinates, col and row are the column and row coordinates.
      Parameters:
      e - MouseEvent related to user's interaction with a mouse.
      normalizer - int coefficient to normalize the mouse coordinates with.
      See Also:
      • Game.validateSelection()

    • mouseMoved

      public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e, int normalizer)
      Calls Game.selectionAt(int, int) when the user moved a mouse on a Swing graphical user interface component.

      Relies on the GameInput.getMouseCoordinates(MouseEvent) implementation of the GameInput instance of this GameController.

      The mouse coordinates need to be normalized to be interpreted as row and column coordinates. This can be achieved using the int normalizer parameter, which does the following: 

       int col = x / normalizer;
 int row = y / normalizer;
      Where x and y are the mouse coordinates, col and row are the column and row coordinates.
      Parameters:
      e - MouseEvent related to user's interaction with a mouse.
      normalizer - int coefficient to normalize the mouse coordinates with.
      See Also:
      • Game.selectionAt(int, int)

    • run

      public void run()
      Initializes this GameController to interact with its Game instance. It first sends a EventType.INIT event type through the game to update its listeners, then starts to poll for user inputs ONLY if its GameInput instance does not implement the SwingIntegrated interface.

      If so, this method relies on the implementation of several methods from the GameInput instance of this GameController:

      • GameInput.getMessage(EventType),
      • GameInput.getEventType(),
      • GameInput.getDifficulty(),
      • GameInput.getCoordinates().
      See Also:
      • SwingIntegrated

    • waitAck

      public void waitAck()
      Asks the user to confirm depending on the strategy sets by the GameInput instance of this GameController.

      Relies on the GameInput.waitAck() implementation of the GameInput instance of this GameController.

    • close

      public void close(JFrame frame)
      Exits the Game instance, disposes a JFrame object from Swing, and calls System.exit(0).
      Parameters:
      frame - The JFrame to call Window.dispose() on.

    • makeButton

      public JButton makeButton(String text, Color fg, Color bg, boolean paintFocus, ActionListener l)
      Creates a new JButton button object with the specified parameters.

      Relies on the GameInput.makeButton(String) implementation of the GameInput instance of this GameController. If it returns null, the result of this method is an invisible object.

      Parameters:
      text - String parameter to display on the button.
      fg - Foreground Color of the button.
      bg - Background Color of the button.
      paintFocus - boolean to set the paintFocus property of the button.
      l - Adds an ActionListener to the button.
      Returns:
      A newly allocated JButton object.

    • makeToggleButton

      public JToggleButton makeToggleButton(String text, Color fg, Color bg, boolean paintFocus, ActionListener l)
      Creates a new JToggleButton button object with the specified parameters.

      Relies on the GameInput.makeToggleButton(String) implementation of the GameInput instance of this GameController. If it returns null, the result of this method is an invisible object.

      Parameters:
      text - String parameter to display on the button.
      fg - Foreground Color of the button.
      bg - Background Color of the button.
      paintFocus - boolean to set the paintFocus property of the button.
      l - Adds an ActionListener to the button.
      Returns:
      A newly allocated JToggleButton object.

    • makeComboBox

      public JComboBox<String> makeComboBox(String[] items, Color fg, Color bg, ActionListener l)
      Creates a new JComboBox<String> combo-box object with the specified parameters.

      Relies on the GameInput.makeComboBox(String[]) implementation of the GameInput instance of this GameController. If it returns null, the result of this method is an invisible object.

      Parameters:
      items - String[] containing labels for the different options.
      fg - Foreground Color of the combo-box.
      bg - Background Color of the combo-box.
      l - Adds an ActionListener to the combo-box
      Returns:
      A newly allocated JComboBox<String> object.

    • makeTextArea

      public JTextArea makeTextArea(int nRow, int nCol)
      Creates a new JTextArea text area object with the specified parameters. It is not editable.

      Relies on the GameInput.makeTextArea(int, int) implementation of the GameInput instance of this GameController. If it returns null, the result of this method is an invisible object.

      Parameters:
      nRow - Number of rows for the text area, as an int.
      nCol - Number of columns for the text area, as an int.
      Returns:
      A newly allocated JTextArea object.

    • makeInfoDialog

      public JDialog makeInfoDialog(String title, String text)
      Creates a new JDialog dialog window object with the specified parameters.

      Relies on the GameInput.makeInfoDialog(String, String) implementation of the GameInput instance of this GameController.

      Parameters:
      title - Title of the dialog window as a String.
      text - Text to display on the dialog window as a String.
      Returns:
      A newly allocated JDialog object.

    • showTwoChoicesDialog

      public void showTwoChoicesDialog(String title, String text, String[] options, Runnable onFirstOption, Runnable onSecondOption)
      Brings up a two-choices dialog set with the specified parameters. Relies on the GameInput.showTwoChoicesDialog(String, String, String[], Runnable, Runnable) implementation of the GameInput instance of this GameController.
      Parameters:
      title - Title of the dialog as a String.
      text - Main text to display on the dialog as a String.
      options - List of option labels as a String[].
      onFirstOption - Operation associated with the first option as a Runnable.
      onSecondOption - Operation associated with the second option as a Runnable.
